Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Small vase in blue-green faience
Description: This small vase in blue-green faience was part of four foundation deposits found in the pyramid of Aspelta at Nuri.The deposits also contained tablettes, plaques in the form of cartouches, slabs and vases. The small container bears a cartouche of Nasalsa (see E.7363), wife of  king Senkamanisken (see E.6097, E.6099, E.6103, E.6109A-B) and mother of kings Anlamani (see E.6108) and Aspelta (see E.7106A-B).
